Package org.firmata4j.firmata

Class FirmataDevice

java.lang.Object
org.firmata4j.firmata.FirmataDevice
All Implemented Interfaces:
IODevice
public class FirmataDevice extends Object implements IODevice
Implements IODevice that is using Firmata protocol.
Author:
Oleg Kurbatov <o.v.kurbatov@gmail.com>

    Description
    FirmataDevice(String portName)

    Constructs FirmataDevice instance that operates on default protocol using specified transport.
    FirmataDevice(TransportInterface transport, FiniteStateMachine protocol)
    Constructs FirmataDevice instance using the specified transport and protocol.

  • Constructor Details

    • FirmataDevice

      public FirmataDevice(String portName)
      Constructs FirmataDevice instance on specified serial port.
      Parameters:
      portName - the serial port name the device is connected to

    • FirmataDevice

      public FirmataDevice(TransportInterface transport)
      Constructs FirmataDevice instance that operates on default protocol using specified transport.
      Parameters:
      transport - the communication channel

    • FirmataDevice

      public FirmataDevice(TransportInterface transport, FiniteStateMachine protocol)
      Constructs FirmataDevice instance using the specified transport and protocol.
      Parameters:
      transport - the communication channel
      protocol - finite state machine that can understand the byte stream from the transport

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start() throws IOException
      Description copied from interface: IODevice
      Initiates communication with hardware.
      This method initialize the IODevice instance. Initialization may take some time depending on speed of communication to hardware.
      To check whether the device is ready, use IODevice.isReady().
      If you want to wait until the device is initializing and continue working with it, use IODevice.ensureInitializationIsDone().
      If you develop application in asynchronous style, you may want to register an event listener that will receive a message when the device is ready.
      Specified by:
      start in interface IODevice
      Throws:
      IOException - when communication cannot be established
      See Also:
      • IODeviceEventListener.onStart(org.firmata4j.IOEvent)

    • stop

      public void stop() throws IOException
      Description copied from interface: IODevice
      Terminates communication with hardware.
      When communication is terminated, an event is published to IODeviceEventListeners.
      Specified by:
      stop in interface IODevice
      Throws:
      IOException - when communication cannot be properly terminated
      See Also:
      • IODeviceEventListener.onStop(org.firmata4j.IOEvent)

    • ensureInitializationIsDone

      public void ensureInitializationIsDone() throws InterruptedException
      Description copied from interface: IODevice
      Waits for initialization is done.
      Use this method if you want to be sure that device is ready to communicate.
      Specified by:
      ensureInitializationIsDone in interface IODevice
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - when the device cannot be started or waiting for initialization is interrupted or connection has not been established during timeout.

    • isReady

      public boolean isReady()
      Description copied from interface: IODevice
      Checks whether the device is fully initialized and ready to use.
      Specified by:
      isReady in interface IODevice
      Returns:
      true if device is ready, false otherwise

    • getPin

      public Pin getPin(int index)
      Description copied from interface: IODevice
      Returns a pin by its index on device. The index should be less than result returned by IODevice.getPinsCount().
      Specified by:
      getPin in interface IODevice
      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • addProtocolMessageHandler

      public void addProtocolMessageHandler(String messageType, Consumer<Event> handler)
      Description copied from interface: IODevice
      Adds handler for low-level events of specified type. "*" is a special type that matches to any message. The handlers registed for that type will receive an even after the hadlers of specific type.
      Specified by:
      addProtocolMessageHandler in interface IODevice
      Parameters:
      messageType - type of low-level event
      handler - handler of the event

      Throws:

    • sendMessage

      public void sendMessage(byte... msg) throws IOException
      Sends raw message to connected Firmata device using open port.
      Consider using FirmataMessageFactory methods to prepare binary messages before sending.
      Specified by:
      sendMessage in interface IODevice
      Parameters:
      msg - the Firmata message
      Throws:
      IOException - when writing fails
      See Also:
      • FirmataMessageFactory
